page.title: 04LITTLE BRIAR'S,EXETER.
page.content: Mr.Garnsworthy bought this 2-3acre nursery 38 years ago,and before this it had been a fruit farm but had become very overgrown.Apart from a break in the 1960's when subsidies to horticulturists on the continent forced him into other work,the present owner has worked this nursery.The farmhouse is about 250 years old and made of cob.It has an old coachhouse attached to it.The coachhouse,now a garage,did have a cobbled floor.Important features include a beautiful conifer garden ascending the hillside and a 75 year old greenhouse. The greenhouse will soon be replaced by an aluminium structure. All greenhouses have gas or oil-fired central heating.
